programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Pilot of the series following colourful life in a large pawn shop, as run by the Gold family. From alligators to false limbs, its staff has no idea what could come through the door next, and profits come with a huge risk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a boer head in hope of a trade, and a woman wants cash for a fur coat despite the summer heat. Series following life in a large pawn shop..

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The fearsome and mysterious gods worshipped by the Norse Vikings, considering whether the super-beings that guided the Vikings were actually visitors from another planet.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about captured aliens, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files hidden away in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Puffy in the Sky with Diamonds
programme.desc: Victor plans to get the better of the competition with some dirty tricks, while one of the teams buys a locker that could prove highly profitable.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Surgeon, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: A locker auction in Texas is in the path of a tornado, so the bidders try to complete their purchases before the storm hits.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A threatening customer puts the store on a high alert, while Ashley and Seth bet on whether a stripper's pole will sell.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash over whether they should be armed after Les's confrontation with a customer, and Ashley fails to close a deal.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A banner from the secret WWII airborne division The Flying Tigers flies into the shop. Plus, Chum gets his hands on a 1980s Ooze-it toy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A suit worn by the Godfather of Soul, James Brown, dances its way into the store.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary learns a harsh lesson about Dave at auctions in Rancho Palos Verdes, California, while Rene puts a secret strategy to the test.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary is forced far out of her comfort zone when the buyers head to Indio, California. Lockers in this desert town hold many treasures, but it remains to be seen who will buy them.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys are keen to win a climate-controlled unit stuffed with contemporary art, but they have some competition. Plus, Clinton has a hunch about a quad bike.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones take a tactical approach to secure a big result at a storage auction, after spotting fishing tackle, a boat motor and instruments in a pair of units.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba compete against Victor to buy a luxury household locker in an auction at Mineral Wells.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The team visits an auction in Irving, where Victor buys a secret agent's locker and Bubba tries to sell some explicit art.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at the events that led to the catastrophic blow-out that tore through Aloha Airlines Flight 243 en route to Hawaii.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files held in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1, suggesting that US government cover-ups occurred.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The movement known as Ancient Astronaut Theory, which was sparked by Erich von Daniken, Swiss author of several books which make controversial claims about extraterrestrial influences on early human culture.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash when a man brings in an angry pet alligator he wants rid of. Les has to keep his composure to avoid making a bad decision.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions mount when a man loses his temper over a mix-up with his gold chain. Meanwhile, an allegedly cursed relic scares Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee shocks the family by turning violent, and Ashley loses her temper when someone tries to steal her underwear.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and his father clash when Les's idea turns dangerous, and Ashley embarks on a new in-house business venture.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones endure disappointment at an auction, but hope a container they have secured at another site will make their day worthwhile.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Storage auction enthusiasts in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, are not pleased when Allen Haff and Ton Jones arrive in town searching for bargains.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: Things get heated as Dog and his team agree to help Leland's new boss with what Dog calls an Alabama Sweep, as they attempt to track down five fugitives in Alabama in a week.

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Two deals are on the line as the team races to get a classic Dodge Viper car from the Dominican Republic and an Apache speedboat from the local marina.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The teams make a long trip to auctions in Palm Desert, and Mary plays a risky game when she bids way beyond her budget.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi hope for more good luck as the buyers return to San Diego, while Ivy comes across a cross-dressing locker.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Miles Jupp, Ava Vidal and Carl Donnelly join Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a 2011 edition of the topical comedy quiz show. Dara O Briain hosts.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: At the halfway stage, all contestants - except Phil Wang - are in with a chance of victory. Kerry Godliman and Jessica Knappett resort to soapy violence.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Doc Martin star Martin Clunes takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Jon Richardson and Newsnight presenter Kirsty Wark joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Host Stephen Fry poses tough questions about Happiness to Andy Hamilton, Rich Hall, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies, and awards points for the answers he deems most interesting.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit's companion show, hosted by Go 8 Bit's resident games expert Ellie Gibson with team captains Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon, featuring lively debates and reviews covering the history of video games with guest stars.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit's companion show, hosted by Go 8 Bit's resident games expert Ellie Gibson with team captains Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle become action sport film directors as they realise their dream of creating a Zombie vs Parkour chase scene.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: A 16-course taster menu is the pinnacle of Nick Helm's culinary pilgrimage to Leeds, where he meets his food hero, chef Michael O'Hare.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick enjoys some American pancakes and goes veggie with Thunder's Luke Morley.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In an antique shop closed since the 1970s, Mike and Frank go toe-to-toe with the sibling owners who negotiate for every last dollar.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori prepare for an explosive auction, where they compete to buy storage units.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori buy storage units at an auction in Redondo Beach, where a safe sparks plenty of interest.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys pick the collection of a reclusive and mysterious businessman named 'the Colonel,' who has gone to great lengths to keep his identity secret.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys uncover a once-in-a-lifetime find and must decide to go big or go home. Mike gets down-and-dirty to rescue an old piece from Mother Nature.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Joel takes on an epic build and Peter travels to a historic gold rush town to build a mining shaft house that would make any prospector proud.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles, and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Head of Fleet Services John Heussi and his team redesign the vehicles that transport the dog units, turning a humble Ford Mondeo into a Dog Van.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier champions two teams of car lovers on their mission to design and build scrap vehicles capable of beating pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar in a daring challenge. This time, they take on the iconic Lamborghini Huracan Performante in a handling head to head. Their mechanical ingenuity and driving skills are put to the ultimate test as they race against both the supercar and the clock.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The hosts bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. They also resort to unusual promotional techniques to attract more visitors to their exhibition. Back on the track, Jeremy Clarkson tests British supercar the Noble M600. Jenson Button drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson spares no expense when he tests the BMW X6. James May joins Margaret Calvert, one of Britain's road-sign designers, to test-drive the Vauxhall Insignia VXR, and Richard Hammond tries out a Â£340,000 Lexus supercar. Plus, musician Seasick Steve is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies challenges his five fearful funny people to entertain him by completing more baffling challenges, which this week involve corneas, crackers and construction.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedians Lucy Porter and Romesh Ranganathan and TV judge Robert Rinder to express their anger over people, events and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include lavish proposals, school reunions and New Year's Eve.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites sports presenter Gabby Logan and comedians Richard Ayoade and Alun Cochrane to express their anger over people, events and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include people who laugh out loud when reading a book, half-and-half scarves - and fun.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Rhod Gilbert takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with writer, director and satirist Armando Iannucci and playwright Lucy Prebble joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by comedians Dara O Briain, Chris Addison, Sean Lock and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions about things that are horrible, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson and regular participant Katherine Ryan are set tasks from pet rescue to pineapple concealment. Host Greg Davies and assitant Alex Horne ultimately decide who wins.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Jen Brister, Rob Beckett and Lou Sanders are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, with music by Clodagh Rodgers.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: The documentary concludes with an insight into Hitler's plans to modernise the German transport system, including super trains and futuristic airports.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Egyptologist David Rohl searches for the location of the Tower of Babel, a Biblical structure which first appeared in the Book of Genesis.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough encounters two species with wrinkly skin, where nature has tinkered with the ageing process to different effect. The mole rat retains its looks while growing old and the elephant looks old from birth, yet both creatures live relatively long lives.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: British physicist Colin Humphreys attempts to find the real route of the Exodus and the true mountain of God.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Liverpool to Manchester Line - The First Modern Railway
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Dark Truth of the Templars
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston uncovers the secrets of the Knights Templar and challenges the accepted views of the order that angered medieval Europe.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: The documentary concludes with an insight into Hitler's plans to modernise the German transport system, including super trains and futuristic airports.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Exploring the military headquarters built beneath Dover Castle during the Second World War and Odessa's catacombs, possibly the largest tunnel network in the world.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The documentary uncovering the hidden history of Britain continues with the story of the department store Selfridges, looking at the ways it changed the country's shopping habits. Plus, an examination of the life of Mr Selfridge himself.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Exploring the military headquarters built beneath Dover Castle during the Second World War and Odessa's catacombs, possibly the largest tunnel network in the world.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador..

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The use of propaganda in Hitler's Nazi regime. The first episode examines the Fuehrer's fascination with propaganda, which began in the trenches of the First World War.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An Albanian village home to Allied secret agents, devastated for resisting the Nazi war machine, and a notorious asylum in America that enforced lobotomies.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, including Tearful Party Guest and Public Service Announcement About Water Shortage.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, with music by Clodagh Rodgers.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Thirteen years after the kidnap and murder of a teenage girl, Boyd finds a crucial piece of evidence and arrests the owner - reclusive hippie Alec Garvey. As the pressure for a conviction mounts from the Met Commissioner and the media, Boyd charges his man - but after the suspect resorts to desperate measures, the detective begins to realise the case is much more complicated than he imagined. Trevor Eve stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gina warns Amber not to tell a soul about her cancer, but any hopes of keeping her illness secret are dashed when she's prescribed a course of daily radiotherapy. Scott reacts badly to the news that Greg's murder charges have been dropped, and Lance's latest assignment on the Cole Lane Estate proves something of a damp squib. Gabriel gives Sheelagh the brush-off, while Reg isn't quite sure what to make of Sun Hill's eager new receptionist Julian Tavell, known as JT.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team rushes to the scene of a bomb explosion at a hotel but, while sifting through the wreckage, Colin is nearly killed. Starring Steve North.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers and their wives head out to Cyprus. The men make a number of mistakes on exercise but are redeemed when they intervene in a critical situation.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave almost drowns during a beach landing exercise. Meanwhile, Donna's sister Kelly falls for one of the locals and Major Kieran Voce has divided loyalties over his love life.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gina warns Amber not to tell a soul about her cancer, but any hopes of keeping her illness secret are dashed when she's prescribed a course of daily radiotherapy. Scott reacts badly to the news that Greg's murder charges have been dropped, and Lance's latest assignment on the Cole Lane Estate proves something of a damp squib. Gabriel gives Sheelagh the brush-off, while Reg isn't quite sure what to make of Sun Hill's eager new receptionist Julian Tavell, known as JT.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tricia receives the results of the paternity test, but claims she doesn't want to know what it says. Michael tells Connie that kissing Chrissie was a mistake - but it's not long before it happens again, and he even offers her a promotion after forcing Lisa to resign. Mubbs realises Andy is attracted to him and tries to exploit this to get the consultant's job - but a mistake in surgery ruins his chances.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Tina worries about Sean's behaviour, Max has an emotional day, and Adam contemplates overhauling the ward's sleeping arrangements. Hospital drama, featuring Martin Freeman prior to his appearance in The Office.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Honey can't bring herself to contemplate the terrifying prospect that fiance Scott might have murdered his first wife, despite Yvonne and Steve's suspicions that there might be something to Greg's allegations. Lance tries to get the Cole Lane Estate's teenage population interested in cricket, hoping to bridge the generation gap and recruit informers at the same time, but his best efforts are jeopardised when Gary sets up a bungled drugs bust.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat hides as news of the accident spreads. Sam plans a weekend away, and Pauline meets an old school friend who makes a big impression on Pete.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Public opinion adds to the pressures on Pat.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: After the threat of closure, the refurbished station reopens - and welcomes two fresh members of staff. Young Billy Rae's inexperience presents a problem, but the Blue Watch have more difficulties learning to trust fellow newcomer Geoff Pearce.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie comes face to face with her estranged mother, and Archie finds himself caught in the middle of the cat fight. Meanwhile, Katrina is stunned to hear her school is scheduled for closure. Light-hearted Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim finds himself embroiled in the glitzy world of cabaret when a lounge singer commits suicide, and he uncovers a possible link to forged banknotes discovered at a racetrack.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline wants Oswald to have a sperm count, and the family meets Jack at the airport when he returns from America. Victor McGuire stars.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Joe Maplin's plans for expansion cause chaos with the Yellowcoats when an old cottage is scheduled for demolition. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy falls out with her boyfriend, and Alistair tries to woo the elusive Judith, giving Jean the perfect chance to leap in with her infallible romantic advice - while the more sceptical Lionel stays well out of the way.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Some Adventures of the Inventor of the Mother Stitch
programme.desc: Barry is shocked to discover his golf captain has moved in next door when Glenda shows a keen interest in her new neighbours. Hobbo tries to help a dejected Morton feel less lonely, while Hobbo's driving skills attract unwanted attention when he takes to the wheel of a truck following a visit to an inn.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: While presiding over a murder trial in which a lawyer is representing himself and his younger siblings, Deed rekindles his affair with the scheming Francesca Rochester, ignoring his pregnant daughter's pleas for help in the process. Blind to what's happening around him, and resisting warnings from Jo, the judge eventually realises his mistress has been deceiving him and must hope he has not left it too late to come to the aid of Charlie and her unborn child. High Court drama, starring Martin Shaw, Jenny Seagrove and Billie Whitelaw.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ricky Hanson faces trial for attempted murder, and his lawyer sets about trying to discredit each member of the squad. However, Jack receives a welcome distraction when an old friend asks him to reinvestigate the death of a wealthy businessman, and he, Brian and Gerry spring into action. Guest starring David Troughton, with Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Alun Armstrong and Dennis Waterman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd is horrified to learn that Carl Mackenzie, the man accused of a shopping centre massacre, has been granted the right to appeal. Refusing to believe the wrong man was convicted, he throws himself into the case, but when the squad unearths new evidence that supports Mackenzie's claim, it also leads to the discovery of some disturbing truths about their superior officer. Trevor Eve stars.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Kim Cattrall is the first guest as the chat show returns, with the actress revealing why she turned down Sex and the City 3 and talking about her relationship with the other cast members following rumoured feuds. She also opens up to Piers about her three marriages and discusses why she was forced to pull out of a West End play.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Ellie and Hardy start to investigate Trish's life and talk to her ex-husband Ian, her best friend's partner Jim, and taxi driver Lucas - all of whom were in the area when the attack took place. The detectives need Trish to give her main video interview, which will be relied on in court if the case goes that far, but she is still traumatised. Hardy decides they should go ahead, but Trish brings the interview to a premature end when they ask her a question she is not prepared to answer. Crime drama, starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Sesame Street star Elmo is in the studio to celebrate his new show Elmo's World.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present the opening day of the prestigious festival, including feature race the 3.30 Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy, plus races at 1.30, 2.10, 2.50 and 4.10. With analysis from AP McCoy and Ruby Walsh, reports from Alice Plunkett, Brian Gleeson, Luke Harvey and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Matt Chapman, social stable thoughts from Oli Bell and Chris Hughes, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Saroop, Karen, Milo and Natalie work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Will is relieved when he tells Cain everything about Malone, Laurel is torn when Jai thinks they should move in together, and Victoria decides to get Harry christened.

programme.title: Dr Ranj: On Call
programme.desc: Dr Ranj Singh offers more advice on how to spot, treat and deal with some of the most common illnesses and accidents. As well as going over the latest medical news, the GP introduces viewers to some of the delicate young lives who are currently in the Paediatric Intensive Care Unit at the Evelina Children's Hospital. Plus, Kylie Pentelow goes to Moorfields Eye Hospital to find out about a breakthrough treatment for glaucoma.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a cleverly designed family garden that's full of fun for pre-school tots without being a primary-coloured plastic eyesore for the grownups who share it. Alan, David Domoney, Katie Rushworth and Frances Tophill also give tips on creating a mini-maze, creative sandpits and how to use plants to give an adventurous exotic flavour to play areas.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actress travels across two of the most enigmatic countries in the Caribbean - Cuba and Haiti - to explore, uncover and share the hidden gems they have to offer. Joanna kicks off her adventure in a Havana boxing gym with one of Cuba's rising female boxing stars. She visits the stars of the cabaret at the National Hotel that pre-dates the revolution, and entertains the cigar workers while they roll cigars in their factory. She visits the small town of Hershey, built on the success of the sugar industry, and visits the tomb of Che Guevara before heading off to Hemingway's favourite beach.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: Following a tougher than expected contest against Otto Wallin, Tyson's father John is critical of trainer Ben Davison, and Fury's team eventually part ways with the trainer as his rematch with Deontay Wilder is finally confirmed. Before the contract is signed for his fight with Wilder, the boxer also takes part in a lucrative WWE bout in Saudi Arabia against Braun Strowman.

programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating next-generation race-cars that run on electricity. Plus, the creation of mead, favourite drink of the Vikings.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Brother and sister team Robbie and Ashleigh hit house removal hell on a mud-bogged mission out of Brisbane. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo battle storms in remote Western Australia.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Teutul Jr is given the contract to design and build a custom bike for the New York Giants NFL team, and the employees prepare for the opening of the company's new HQ.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Nick challenges Dan to a Chevelle v Camaro supercar showdown, meaning Dan must build a '69 Camaro Pace Car to beat the fastest Chevelle that FantomWorks has ever built.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe travels to the middle of Connecticut to clean out a lake, then visits a gourd farm in Pennsylvania.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how items such as wagon wheels, violin bows and thinning shears are made, and how processes have been enhanced over time.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Iron Bathtubs/Hopi Kachina Dolls/Mine Truck Engine/Memory Cards
programme.desc: The manufacture of iron bathtubs, Hopi Kachina dolls, mine truck engines and memory cards.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Investigating how the iconic fedora hat is fashioned, how cement is made, and how millions of peas are harvested and frozen in under three hours.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in the first series, showcasing the best of their adventures and ultimate restorations.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crews race to catch the remainder of their quotas, Scottie Hillstrand makes a dangerous mistake and a radio message brings ominous tidings as the fleet heads for port.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The Pomrenkes hit pay dirt and bring in 10 pounds of gold, while recently fired Scott swallows his pride and asks Hank for his old job back.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Brother and sister team Robbie and Ashleigh hit house removal hell on a mud-bogged mission out of Brisbane. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo battle storms in remote Western Australia.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer enlists the help of mechanic Edd China to make a 1980s BMW 325i Touring roadworthy once more.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes off the BMW's suspension and wheel bearings, before handing the car over to Mike Brewer, who tries to sell it for profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.sub-title: Wayne Won't You Buy Me a Mercedes Benz?
programme.desc: Wayne Carini advises on how to sell an exceptional car collection, including a Mercedes 500K and a 1922 Mercer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini prepares to attend the Pris d'LeMons car exhibition, and hopes his Volvo P18 Wagon will stand out among the vehicles on show.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in the first series, showcasing the best of their adventures and ultimate restorations.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: Spring brings new challenges for the off-gridders as they scramble to repair their cabins, while the freight team prepares its most dangerous load of the year.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crab season gets off to a bad start as skippers Keith Colburn and Phil Harris await the results of medical tests, while repairs to some of the boats leave the owners in debt.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: As the season's midway point passes, some dredges struggle to make a profit, captains are challenged by uncooperative crews and relationships are tested.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a country house sale in Norfolk, and in Glasgow finds a unique tartan piece at a classic tailor's. Plus, he finds his oddest buy ever in Liverpool.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Trucking legend Steve and his dog Bella take a huge load cross-country from Alice Springs to Perth. Meanwhile, engine issues see Russell struggle to hit a delivery deadline.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China take advantage of an iconic three wheeler, the Messerschmitt KR200, as it is about to celebrate its 60th birthday.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's travel all over America in search of the most interesting, rare and profit-bringing treasures, from old bangers to classic toys.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Lincolnshire, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits a 16th-century Elizabethan mansion and hits the jackpot at a brewery.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Three British farmers try to run three very different family farms, revealing the challenges and rewards that come with making a living off the land.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Restorers get to work on a grandfather clock, hoping to make it chime again, and doctors perform surgery on a teddy bear with only one ear and one arm after a run-in with a puppy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction and maintenance of the Mississippi River's famous steam-powered paddleboats, and the creation of the powerful 'waterfall' defence system.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex processes involved in creating modern-day paving stones. Plus, the construction of a traditionally tailored tuxedo suit.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Detectives try to catch a violent rapist who has been attacking women in Denver, Colorado.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A woman is admitted to hospital following a serious seizure, and an investigation is launched when her husband confesses to poisoning her.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The story of school monitor Kendall Francois, who killed eight women in Poughkeepsie, New York, and hid the bodies in his home.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: How the double homicide of a young mother and her baby daughter sent Galax's tiny police force on a frenzied mission to stop unspeakable evil in its tracks.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for the FALN terrorist group, who were suspected of setting off several bombs across America during the 1970s and 1980s.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A heat-exhausted domestic rabbit is abandoned in a car park, but proves tricky to catch. Investigator Mark persuades the owner of six underfed dogs to give them more food.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The consultants find the pressure is on to make sales in the current economic climate. Audrey remodels a gown and Vera rescues a fitting when she alters a neckline.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer tries to reconcile her personal style with her desire to be a very traditional bride, and another woman hopes her grandmother approves of her choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Won the Battle Against My Twin
programme.desc: A bride tries to get her twin sister's approval of her dress, while another customer needs all four of her siblings to agree with her choice of gown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown gets hands-on with an angry alligator, a dehydrated puppy struggles, Lucky the cat swallows a large amount of human medication and a parrot is involved in a love triangle.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Archie the Labrador suffers life-threatening shakes, a canine gets a fishing hook stuck in its mouth, a snake takes a dip in an old woman's pool and a walleroo requires help.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A look at daily life in New York's Bronx Zoo, documenting the routine operations that provide quality care for animals while educating the public on wildlife and conservation.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road in Sheffield, Dan Hatfield and his team try to do a deal on a tank, and one customer wants Â£10,000 for his gold - but can Dan help him reach his target? At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south-east London, boss Nathan Finch is bewitched by some valuable paintings, and wants to do a deal on some stunning earrings that could kick-start a dream business.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Two of America's leading coroners explain how pivotal their job can be in a murder investigation.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Hatice Corbacioglu, who vanished in June 2009 while visiting lover Riza Cosa in New York. The plot thickened when Cosa fled to his native Turkey and the body of his wife was was found stuffed in a bag in a New York steel factory where he had worked. A year later, in an apparent suicide, Cosa fell to his death from a tall building,.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of big game hunter Bob, who was is fooled by a predatory con-artist and put a $1,000 deposit on a non-existent Thunderbird.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 34-year-old Susan Casey. The mother-of-four's body was found floating in the Yellowstone River in May 2008, but the autopsy report concluded that she had been strangled. The investigation went cold for a few years until her ex-husband Walter Larson was arrested.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: Couch-lovers Lisa and Vinny are getting wed but had no time to focus on themselves, so style expert George Kotsiopoulos tries to revive them in time for the big day.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: George tries to help busy couple Jessica and David, who have let style and fashion slide thanks to full-time jobs and raising a son.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: George tries to save the day for Brittany and Justin, who were just one month away from their wedding date when a fire destroyed everything they had.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore, electronics expert Horse and furniture restorer Jay Blades visit Walsall in the West Midlands, where they repurpose some side cabinets, a leather box and an old sofa.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, London Road Pawnbrokers boss Dan hunts for a local artist regarding potentially valuable paintings, and an unusual silver sombrero could be worth a small fortune.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Nikki works out in preparation for skin removal surgery, but a devastating personal loss leaves her anxious something may go wrong.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: People weighing over 600 pounds try to lose the weight that is threatening their lives.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How scientists traced the murderer of 12-year-old Polly Klaas, who was snatched from her home during a slumber party by a stranger. Laser technology detected a normally invisible palm print, and fibres collected from the scene were eventually matched to the killer, enabling a conviction.
